text.p: Trasta Bank said on Monday that the share issue of the Balta insurance company was oversubscribed by around 50 times.
"According to provisional information, the new issue was (of 200,000 shares) was over-subscribed roughly 50 times," Roberts Idelsons, head of the securities department at Trasta, told Reuters.
"The official subscription results will be released on Wednesday," he said. The subscription lasted for three weeks and ended on July 25.
Idelsons said the big demand for the insurance company was a sign of general interest in the Riga stock market.
He declined to say whether local or foreign investors dominated during the subscription.
Balta, the biggest insurance company in the Baltic countries by way of paid-up capital, is expected to get a bourse listing early this autumn.
